title: RelMix 1.4
text: Start RelMix typing following command R console open user interface seen Figure 1.  Figure 1: RelMix main window.

title: RelMix 1.4
text: example consider paternity case mixed DNA profile mother child, addition reference profiles mother alleged father.

title: RelMix 1.4
text: first step RelMix import data. import files must either comma, semicolon tab-separated must dots decimal separators. Examples given three types files needed: mixture profile, reference profiles allele frequencies. files also found folder ‘extdata’ relMix installation. mixture profile reference profiles contain loci order, allele frequency file can contain additional loci profiles. RelMix give error message data file error fatal program. RelMix return warning minor error data file fatal program.

previous_headings: Example 1: A paternity case > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.4
text: Table 1 shows structure mixture file. first line contain column names shown : ‘SampleName’, ‘Marker’, ‘Allele1’ etc. mixture profile example maximum three unique alleles per markers, file may expanded columns ‘Allele4’, ‘Allele5’ additional observed alleles. example 22 markers, first five shown . autosomal markers can included. Marker names case sensitive, error message given markers found database. Table 1: mixture profile example 1. multiple replicates, next replicate profile must different sample name (e.g. “relMix2”) follow directly first replicate (.e. blank lines ).

previous_headings: Example 1: A paternity case > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.4
text: Table 2 shows format file containing reference profiles (reference profiles file). first line correspond column names seen . different reference profiles follow directly , profile specific sample name. example two reference profiles, “Mother” “Father”. file shoud contain profiles individuals defined pedigree. Note: long built-pedigrees used, reference profiles named either “Father”, “Mother” “Child” individual IDs defined pedigrees. custom pedigrees provided, sample name can used (see example 2 ). first two markers last one shown profile. Table 2: Reference profiles mother alleged father example 1.

previous_headings: Example 1: A paternity case > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.4
text: Figure 2: Database window. clicking database button main interface, window Figure 2 appears. Table 3 shows format allele frequencies imported . one row per allele one column per marker. blank space indicates allele observed marker. excerpt database shown . Table 3: Excerpt allele frequency database example 1. Dots used decimal separator. Clicking ‘Option’ button opens window Figure 3 three additional settings: theta value correct population substructure, silent allele frequency minimum allele frequency. alleles frequencies minimum allele frequency default set 0.001, also applies previously unobserved alleles. example keep default values.  Figure 3: Database options. Theta value, silent allele frequency minimum allele frequency. clicking ‘Save’ return window Figure 2, need click ‘ok’ exit database settings. previously unobserved allele (.e. database) found imported profiles, notification given alllele added database minimum allele frequency. allele frequencies sum 1, question appear whether like scale frequencies. , rest allele added.

title: RelMix 1.4
text: example consider mutations, can ignore ‘Mutations’ button.

title: RelMix 1.4
text: pedigrees define hypotheses. three choices pedigrees: ‘Paternity’, ‘Unrelated’ ‘Custom’. choose ‘Paternity’ first pedigree ‘Unrelated’ (alleged father child unrelated) second pedigree (Figure 4). example 2 show define custom pedigree.  Figure 4: Define pedigrees example 1.

title: RelMix 1.4
text: Clicking ‘Specify contributors’ button opens window Figure 5. tick individuals pedigree mixture, case mother child. possible different contributors pedigree, contributors hypotheses.  Figure 5: Specify mother child contributors pedigrees example 1.

title: RelMix 1.4
text: last step specify dropout drop-values. See Dørum et al. (2017) detailed description drop-/dropout model. default values set 0. case expect dropout mother set dropout probability 0, child given dropout probability 0.1. drop-value set 0.05 (Figure 6).  Figure 6: example 1 assume dropout probabilities 0 mother 0.1 child drop-0.05. Note dropout values set, error window occur. Even include dropout drop-, must open dropout window click save button.

title: RelMix 1.4
text: Finally, ready click ‘Compute LR’ button. result appears new pop-window (Figure 7). chosen parameters displayed left, top right shows pedigrees, followed total LR table displaying LRs per marker. clicking “Save results file”, LRs together mixture profiles, reference profiles parameters saved file.  Figure 7: Results example 1.

what: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree
title: RelMix 1.4
text: Click RESTART button starting new case. example two-person mixture one known contributor, hypothesised whether second contributor child first contributor, someone unrelated. take silent alleles mutations account. one locus considered.

previous_headings: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree > 1. Import data
title: RelMix 1.4
text: allele frequencies one diallelic marker given Table 6. Table 6: Allele frequencies. database options set silent allele frequency equal 0.1 (Figure 8).  Figure 8: Database options example 2. clicking ‘ok’ button asked want scale add rest allele since frequencies longer sum 1 now silent allele frequency added. click yes scale.  Figure 9: Scale frequencies add rest allele. Note 1: rest allele can addded sum frequencies less 1. Therefore, enforced scaling performed click ‘’ sum larger 1. Note 2: added rest allele given name ‘r’. stepwise mutation model chosen (see section ), numeric allele names required, case scaling must chosen.

previous_headings: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree
title: RelMix 1.4
text: Clicking mutation button main interface opens new window. default mutations accounted (mutation rate set 0). three mutation models choose . ‘Equal’ mutation model assumes mutations equally likely, ‘Proportional’ model assumes mutation rates proportional allele frequencies, ‘Stepwise’ mutation model assumes mutations closer allelles (fewer sequence repeats difference) probable. ‘Stepwise’ chosen, range must also specified indicates relative probability mutating n+1 steps versus mutating n steps. mutation model requires allele names numerics indicating number sequence repeats. account microinvariants, treat mutations microinvariants practically impossible. option corresponds model ‘Stepwise (unstationary)’ Familias 3. Mutations silent alleles possible models. See Familias manual details mutation models. example use equal mutation model mutation rate 0.1 males females.  Figure 10: Mutations example 2.

previous_headings: Example 2: Mutations, silent alleles and custom pedigree
title: RelMix 1.4
text: Since hypotheses example covered built-pedigrees, provide RelMix custom pedigrees defined text file ped format. ped file can created e.g. online pedigree creator QuickPed, can also generated manually. Table 7 shows ped file specifying first pedigree two contributors mother child. Table 7: ped file specifying mother-child pedigree example 2. second pedigree, two contributors unrelated, specified ped file Table 8. Table 8: ped file specifying two contributors example 2 unrelated. Note: names individuals pedigree (id) must correspond names individuals reference profiles. Figure 11 shows import custom pedigrees R scripts, one script per pedigree.  Figure 11: import custom pedigrees R scripts example 2.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dorum G, Hernandis E (2024). relMix: Relationship Inference DNA Mixtures. R package version 1.4, https://gdorum.github.io/relMix/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {relMix: Relationship Inference for DNA Mixtures},   author = {Guro Dorum and Elias Hernandis},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.4},   url = {https://gdorum.github.io/relMix/}, }

title: Relationship Inference for DNA Mixtures
text: relMix makes relationship inference involving DNA mixtures unknown profiles interprets DNA mixtures related contributors. main function graphical user interface relMixGUI. tutorial can found : https://gdorum.github.io/relMix/articles/relMix.html

title: Relationship Inference for DNA Mixtures
text: Install CRAN follows: Alternatively, install latest development version GitHub: provide pedigree plots, relMix uses package tkrplot. However, package compatibility issues MacOS hence included hard dependency. Users wish see pedigree plots results screen install package tkrplot manually tkrplot package loaded relMix automatially, users need run library("tkrplot") advance.
code: install.packages("relMix") # First install devtools if needed if(!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") #Install relMix from GitHub: devtools::install_github("gdorum/relMix") install.packages("tkrplot")

title: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile
text: Elias Hernandis

title: Load and check a frequency file — checkFrequenciesFile
code: mixfile <- system.file("extdata","mixture.txt",package="relMix") mix <- checkMixtureFile(mixfile) # note: the mixture data frame is passed as an argument # if the previous check failed, the program should not continue # with the frequencies file check freqfile <- system.file('extdata','frequencies22Markers.txt',package='relMix') freqs <- checkFrequenciesFile(freqfile, mix$df)

title: Load and check a mixture file — checkMixtureFile
code: mixfile <- system.file("extdata","mixture.txt",package="relMix") result <- checkMixtureFile(mixfile); print(result$df); #>    SampleName   Marker Allele1 Allele2 Allele3 #> 1     relMix1   CSF1PO      10    12.0      NA #> 2     relMix1 D10S1248      14    16.0      NA #> 3     relMix1  D13S317       8    12.0    13.0 #> 4     relMix1 D14S1434      10    13.0      NA #> 5     relMix1  D16S539      10    11.0    13.0 #> 6     relMix1  D19S433      13    14.0    15.2 #> 7     relMix1  D1S1656      15    17.3      NA #> 8     relMix1  D1S1677      13    14.0    15.0 #> 9     relMix1  D2S1338      17    19.0    20.0 #> 10    relMix1  D2S1776      11    12.0      NA #> 11    relMix1   D2S441      10    11.0    14.0 #> 12    relMix1  D3S1358      15    16.0      NA #> 13    relMix1  D4S2408       8    10.0    11.0 #> 14    relMix1  D5S2500      14    18.0      NA #> 15    relMix1   D5S818       9    12.0      NA #> 16    relMix1  D6S1043      11    18.0      NA #> 17    relMix1   D6S474      14      NA      NA #> 18    relMix1   D7S820      10    11.0      NA #> 19    relMix1  D8S1179      13    14.0    15.0 #> 20    relMix1  D9S2157       7    11.0    12.0 #> 21    relMix1     TH01       6     8.0     9.3 #> 22    relMix1     TPOX       8    10.0    11.0 print(result$warning); #> NULL print(result$error); #> NULL

title: Check a pedigree file — checkPedigreeFile
code: #First load mixture file mixfile <- system.file("extdata","mixture_silent_ex.txt",package="relMix") mix <- checkMixtureFile(mixfile); #Load reference file reffile <- system.file("extdata","references_silent.txt",package="relMix") ref <- checkReferenceFile(reffile, mix$df) #Check pedigree file pedfile <- system.file("extdata","custom_pedigree_maternity_duo.ped",package="relMix") checkPedigreeFile(pedfile,ref$df); #> Pedigree file C:/R/library/relMix/extdata/custom_pedigree_maternity_duo.ped is imported #> $df #> $id #>   C1   C2  #> "C1" "C2"  #>  #> $findex #> [1] 0 0 #>  #> $mindex #> [1] 0 1 #>  #> $sex #> [1] "female" "male"   #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "FamiliasPedigree" #>  #> $warning #> NULL #>  #> $error #> NULL #>

#> 19     Mother  D8S1179      14    15.0 #> 20     Mother  D9S2157       7    12.0 #> 21     Mother     TH01       8     9.3 #> 22     Mother     TPOX       8    11.0 #> 23     Father   CSF1PO Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
text: locus list class FamiliasLocus containing information locus knownGenos List known genotypes. element vector genotype one individual. elements must named idsU Vector indices unknown individuals

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
text: data matrix genotypes row corresponds individual.

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
text: Guro Dorum

title: Create data matrix with possible genotype combinations for specified individuals — createDatamatrix
code: #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.5,0.5) #Create locus object locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name="M1",allelenames= alleles) #Known genotypes of alleged father and mother, child's genotype is uknown gAF <- c(1,1) gMO <- c(1,1) datamatrix <- createDatamatrix(locus,knownGenos=list(AF=gAF,MO=gMO),idsU=c("CH"))

title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
text: Guro Dorum

title: Create a mixture of genotypes with simulated drop-in and dropout — generateMix
code: #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.5,0.5) #Genotypes gM <- c(1,1) gC <- c(1,2) #Dropout and drop-in values d <- 0.1 di <- 0.05 #No drop-in for first contributor D <- list(c(0,0),c(d,d^2)) R <- generateMix(G=list(gM,gC),alleles,afreq,D=D,di=di)

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
text: Guro Dorum

title: Likelihoods for DNA mixtures with dropout and dropin — mixLikDrop
code: #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.5,0.5) #Genotypes gM <- c(1,1) gC <- c(1,2) #Mixture alleles R <- c(1,2) #Dropout and drop-in values d <- 0.1 di <- 0.05 #No drop-in for first contributor D <- list(c(0,0),c(d,d^2)) mixLikDrop(R=R,G=list(gM,gC),D=D,di=di,alleleNames=alleles,afreq=afreq) #> [1] 0.9025

what: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: Calculates likelihoods relationship inference involving mixtures missing reference profiles, including drop-dropout, mutations, silent alleles theta correction.

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
code: relMix(   pedigrees,   locus,   R,   datamatrix,   ids,   D = rep(list(c(0, 0)), length(ids)),   di = 0,   kinship = 0 )

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: pedigrees list pedigrees defined using FamiliasPedigree locus list class FamiliasLocus containing information locus. Note silent allele must indicated 's' ('silent' Familias) R vector mixture alleles, list multiple replicates datamatrix data frame line corresponds one constellation genotypes involved individuals. Indices individuals must given rownames must correspond indices pedigree ids Index vector indicating individuals contributors mixture. indices must correspond indices pedigree D List numeric dropout values (0 1) per contributor. element vector containing heterozygous homozygous dropout probability given contributor di numeric drop-value (0 1) kinship numeric value 0 1 defines theta-parameter

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: numeric likelihood pedigree named according pedigrees, matrix likelihoods pedigree term (genotype constellation) considered calculation (one row per term).

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: function requires package Familias calls function FamiliasPosterior.

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
text: Navreet Kaur, Thore Egeland, Guro Dorum

title: Relationship inference based on mixtures — relMix
code: #Example 1: paternity trio with mixture of mother and child #Define alleles and frequencies alleles <- 1:2 afreq <- c(0.4,0.6) #Define pedigrees persons <- c("CH","MO","AF") ped1 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=persons, dadid=c("AF",NA, NA), momid=c("MO", NA,NA),                         sex=c("male", "female", "male")) ped2 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=c(persons, "TF"), dadid=c("TF", NA, NA,NA),                         momid=c("MO", NA, NA,NA), sex=c("male", "female", "male", "male")) pedigrees <- list(isFather = ped1, unrelated=ped2) #Create locus object locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name="M1",                       allelenames= alleles) #Known genotypes of alleged father and mother gAF <- c(1,1) gMO <- c(1,1) #Mixture alleles R <- c(1,2) datamatrix <- createDatamatrix(locus,knownGenos=list(AF=gAF,MO=gMO),idsU=c("CH")) #Define dropout and drop-in values d <- 0.1 di <- 0.05 res <- relMix(pedigrees, locus, R, datamatrix, ids=c("MO","CH"),              D=list(c(0,0),c(d,d^2)),di=di, kinship=0) #LR=0.054 res$isFather/res$unrelated #> [1] 0.05417118  #Example 2: Exhaustive example with silent allele, mutations, dropout and drop-in #H1: Contributors are mother and child #H2: Contributors are mother and unrelated #Possible dropout in both contributors gMO <- c(1,1) #Mother's genotype R <- 1 #Mixture alleles #Mother/child pedigree persons <- c("CH","MO") ped1 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=persons, dadid=c(NA,NA), momid=c("MO", NA),                         sex=c("male", "female")) ped2 <- Familias::FamiliasPedigree(id=c(persons), dadid=c(NA, NA),                         momid=c( NA, NA),                         sex=c("male", "female")) pedigrees <- list(H1 = ped1, H2=ped2) #Alleles and frequencies: #When silent alleles are involved, a custom mutation matrix is required. #No mutations are possible to or from silent alleles. #We create the mutation model with FamiliasLocus and modify it before it is #passed on to relMix alleles <- c(1,2,'silent') afreq <- c(0.4,0.5,0.1) #Create initial locus object with mutation matrix locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name='M1',                       allelenames= alleles, MutationModel='Equal',                       femaleMutationRate=0.1,maleMutationRate=0.1) #Modify mutation matrix from Familias: #Silent allele must be given as 's' (not 'silent' as in Familias) newAlleles <- c(alleles[-length(alleles)],'s') mm <- locus$femaleMutationMatrix colnames(mm) <- rownames(mm) <- newAlleles #Create new locus object with modified mutation matrix locus <- Familias::FamiliasLocus(frequencies=afreq,name='M1',                       allelenames= newAlleles, MutationModel='Custom', MutationMatrix=mm) knownGenos <- list(gMO) names(knownGenos) <- c("MO") datamatrix <- createDatamatrix(locus,knownGenos,ids="CH") d <- 0.1 #Dropout probability for both contributors di <- 0.05 res2 <- relMix(pedigrees, locus, R, datamatrix, ids=c("MO","CH"),               D=list(c(d,d^2),c(d,d^2)),di=di, kinship=0) #LR=1.68 res2$H1/res2$H2 #> [1] 1.677973

title: relMix 1.4
text: CRAN release: 2024-04-23

title: relMix 1.4
text: New features Custom pedigree files relMixGUI must specified text files ped format instead R scripts relMixGUI now also accept non-numeric allele names exception mutation model “stepwise” used improved report file includes Allele frequencies used LR calculations Plots pedigrees used hypothesis saved word file rather txt file

title: relMix 1.4
text: Incorrect table structure Incorrect headers Typos marker sample names Non-numeric allele frequencies Duplicate markers checkFrequenciesFile() checkMixtureFile() checkReferenceFile() checkPedigreeFile()

title: relMix 1.4
text: Package updated use gWidgets2 gWidgets2tcltk instead gWidgets gWidgetstcltk latter removed CRAN.

title: relMix 1.4
text: Replace deprecated argument initialFilename updated name initial.filename call gWidgets2::gfile function. Fix bug database alleles set NA. Avoid saving loaded profiles error occurs f_importprof. Fix issue allele repeated mixture file, present database file, get added twice causing error Familias called.

title: relMix 1.4
text: Make tkrplot suggests dependency users install can still use non-plotting functionality relMix. Now, tkrplot available, pedigrees plotted results screen instead message explaining problem shown.
